data.name: InconsistentAccessibilityInFieldType_Title
data.value: Change field type '{0}' accessibility to be as accessible as field '{1}'

data.name: InconsistentAccessibilityInIndexerParameter_Title
data.value: Change parameter type '{0}' accessibility to be as accessible as indexer 'this[{1}]'

data.name: InconsistentAccessibilityInIndexerReturnType_Title
data.value: Change indexer return type '{0}' accessibility to be as accessible as indexer 'this[{1}]'

data.name: InconsistentAccessibilityInMethodParameter_Title
data.value: Change parameter type '{0}' accessibility to be as accessible as method '{1}'

data.name: InconsistentAccessibilityInMethodReturnType_Title
data.value: Change return type '{0}' accessibility to be as accessible as method '{1}'

data.name: InconsistentAccessibilityInPropertyType_Title
data.value: Change property type '{0}' accessibility to be as accessible as property '{1}'

data.name: ConsoleWriteLineAnalyzer_Description
data.value: String interpolation allows for better reading of the resulting string when compared to Console.WriteLine arguments. You should use Console.WriteLine with arguments only when another method is supplying the format string.

data.name: ConsoleWriteLineAnalyzer_MessageFormat
data.value: Use string interpolation

data.name: ConsoleWriteLineAnalyzer_Title
data.value: Use string interpolation instead of arguments on Console.WriteLine

data.name: ConsoleWriteLineCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Change to string interpolation

data.name: NameOfAnalyzer_Description
data.value: In C#6 the nameof() operator should be used to specify the name of a program element instead of a string literal as it produce code that is easier to refactor.

data.name: NameOfAnalyzer_MessageFormat
data.value: Use 'nameof({0})' instead of specifying the program element name.

data.name: NameOfAnalyzer_Title
data.value: Use nameof

data.name: NameOfCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Use nameof()

data.name: StringFormatAnalyzer_Description
data.value: String interpolation allows for better reading of the resulting string when compared to String.Format. You should use String.Format only when another method is supplying the format string.

data.name: StringFormatAnalyzer_MessageFormat
data.value: Use string interpolation

data.name: StringFormatAnalyzer_Title
data.value: Use string interpolation instead of String.Format

data.name: StringFormatCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Change to string interpolation

data.name: MakeMethodNonAsyncCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Make method non async

data.name: XmlDocumentationAnalyzer_Title
data.value: You have missing/unexistent parameters in Xml Docs

data.name: XmlDocumentationCreateMissingParametersCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Create missing parameters in xml docs

data.name: XmlDocumentationRemoveNonExistentParametersCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Remove unexistent parameters in xml docs

data.name: SwitchToAutoPropAnalyzer_Description
data.value: Auto properties offer a more concise way of defining a property. If you are using simple getters and setters you are able to simplify your code with autoproperties.

data.name: SwitchToAutoPropAnalyzer_MessageFormat
data.value: Change {0} to an auto property

data.name: SwitchToAutoPropAnalyzer_Title
data.value: Use auto property

data.name: SwitchToAutoPropCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Change to auto property

data.name: EmptyCatchBlockAnalyzer_Description
data.value: An empty catch block suppress all errors and shouldn't be used.\r\nIf the error is expected consider logging it or changing the control flow such that it is explicit.

data.name: EmptyCatchBlockAnalyzer_Message
data.value: Empty Catch Block.

data.name: EmptyCatchBlockAnalyzer_Title
data.value: Catch block cannot be empty

data.name: EmptyCatchBlockCodeFixProvider_InsertException
data.value: Insert Exception class to Catch

data.name: EmptyCatchBlockCodeFixProvider_Remove
data.value: Remove Empty Catch Block

data.name: EmptyCatchBlockCodeFixProvider_RemoveAndDocumentation
data.value: Remove Empty Catch Block and Put a Documentation Link about Try...Catch use

data.name: EmptyCatchBlockCodeFixProvider_RemoveTry
data.value: Remove wrapping Try Block

data.name: ReplaceWithGetterOnlyAutoPropertyAnalyzer_Description
data.value: Getter only properties with backing read-only field can be converted to getter-only auto-properties.

data.name: ReplaceWithGetterOnlyAutoPropertyAnalyzer_MessageFormat
data.value: Property {0} can be converted to an getter-only auto-property.

data.name: ReplaceWithGetterOnlyAutoPropertyAnalyzer_Title
data.value: Property can be simplified by using an getter-only auto-property.

data.name: ReplaceWithGetterOnlyAutoPropertyCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Simplify by using an getter-only auto-property

data.name: IntroduceFieldFromConstructorAnalyzer_Description
data.value: Consider introduce field for constructor parameters.

data.name: IntroduceFieldFromConstructorAnalyzer_MessageFormat
data.value: Introduce a field for parameter: {0}

data.name: IntroduceFieldFromConstructorAnalyzer_Title
data.value: Consider introduce field for constructor parameters.

data.name: IntroduceFieldFromConstructorCodeFixProvider_MessageFormat
data.value: Introduce field: {0} from constructor.

data.name: IntroduceFieldFromConstructorCodeFixProvider_Title
data.value: Introduce fields for constructor parameters.

data.name: PropertyChangedEventArgsUnnecessaryAllocation_Description
data.value: Creating every time an instance of PropertyChangedEventArgs class causes unnecessary memory allocation. Instance can be created once and reused.

data.name: PropertyChangedEventArgsUnnecessaryAllocation_MessageFormat
data.value: Create PropertyChangedEventArgs static instance and reuse it to avoid unecessary memory allocation.

data.name: PropertyChangedEventArgsUnnecessaryAllocation_Title
data.value: PropertyChangedEventArgs unnecessary allocation

data.name: PropertyChangedEventArgsUnnecessaryAllocation_CodeActionTitle
data.value: Create static PropertyChangedEventArgs instance and reuse
